intro: Lippia primulina, commonly known as Mexican blueweed, is a flowering plant native to Central America and parts of the southern United States. It is a member of the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its small, blue or purple flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows in moist, sunny habitats such as prairies and along stream banks. It has narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, four-lobed fruits. Lippia primulina is often used in traditional medicine for its purported anti-inflammatory and antioxidant properties.
